instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turn on
threads.message:
Macbook does not turn on.
have
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1.02v
Apparently there is no short to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turn on
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (not L7030) and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> (L6960/61).
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is the first voltage to appear on the board.

If you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>, then post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0.9V
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> = 5.2V
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = 5,2V
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 1,26 V
VDDA = 5,01
VDDP = 4,90
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL> = BGA PARA BGA SEM PONTO DE TESTE

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turn on
threads.message: What about diode mode readings above requested???
